page.title: 13LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The landscape to the south of Preston Capes has changed dramatically in the last l0 years. Gone are the elms, due to Dutch Elm disease, and gone are the small fields with names - hedgerows have been stipped from the countryside to make way for larger fields and farm machinery. The buildings in and around Preston Capes have not changed as much. Next to the Manor House the most important and interesting house in the village is the Old School House, recently renovated, which was built around l690. The most unusual properties are Archway Cottges which were built in the l8th century as four cottages - now two - for workers from Fawsley House. They have a red brick connecting archway which looks like a castle viewed from Fawsley Park.
